tweet: Spoke at the Berrien County Farm Bureau Legislative Breakfast this morning. Good to see so many friends. Michigan farmers feed the world – but they’re facing some tough challenges. We continue to work in a bipartisan fashion on solutions for #MI06’s ag community. pic.twitter.com/JbM0Y5NTbx

BREAKING: Today the @USDA 
announced a secretarial disaster designation for Berrien, Cass & St. Joseph counties. 

It's welcome news and a good start. But I will continue to encourage them to approve our disaster designation request for all of MI. #MI06  https://upton.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=401261 … pic.twitter.com/9zuiy5IZfs

Yesterday was incredible - we opened a time capsule from the Louis Cassius Upton Memorial Technical Center from 1963!

We found inside an old newspaper, a 1963 yearbook, a key to the city, + more. #MI06 https://www.heraldpalladium.com/news/local/a-little-taste-of/article_eaff4091-df4c-54ee-8858-493873b87556.html …

Great to be at the Lakeshore Rotary Club this afternoon. Shared an update on what we’ve been working on in Congress so far in 2019 and what we hope to accomplish in the coming months. Good to see everyone! #MI06 pic.twitter.com/9TAYhsQ7gm

Great Van Buren Farm Bureau Dinner yesterday in Hartford. Appreciated everyone being there. Michigan ag feeds America & the world but it is no secret our farmers are facing tough challenges - labor shortages, bad weather & econ uncertainty. Working hard on solutions! #MI06 pic.twitter.com/3y9sm9SpEt

With the bipartisan Jake Laird Act, states like Michigan can receive grants by adopting common-sense ‘Red Flag’ laws– w/ stringent due process & probable cause– to prevent those in imminent danger to themselves or others to have firearms. The Jake Laird Act is just common-sense! https://twitter.com/SusanWBrooks/status/1164225480972787712 …

Job market is evolving. 3.4M manufacturing jobs are expected to be created over the next 10yrs, yet 2/3 of those jobs may not be filled due to the skills gap.

I want to send a 'thank you' to our CTE educators for what they're doing to prepare our kids for the jobs of the future. https://twitter.com/DaveEhlers_CCS/status/1164217659484987392 …

Stopped by the St. Joseph and Kalamazoo County Farm Bureau meeting yesterday – good to see so many friends. We’re working hard to get relief for our farmers and producers after a challenging year for our agriculture community. We’re so grateful for Michigan ag! #MI06 pic.twitter.com/Q5pwEo6psQ

Asian Carp present a very real threat to the Great Lakes. Together, we need to continue fighting to keep Asian Carp OUT of our beautiful Great Lakes. 

We must succeed in order to protect our fishing, boating, and tourism industries. https://www.woodtv.com/news/michigan/study-asian-carp-could-find-plenty-of-food-in-lake-michigan/ …
…We all valued Don’s candor & love for our great state & nation. RIP my friend.

Don Gilmer was a consummate “governing” public official willing to listen to all and make the proper decision for his constituents. Honest as the day is long, he was deeply respected & certainly was a mentor for me...

ICYMI: WMU has secured additional funding for research to help combat the opioid epidemic. A big win for our district and state! 😎 Read more here: https://upton.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=401258 …
Today on #NationalPurpleHeartDay we remember all those who have fought and sacrificed for our nation. We promise to #NeverForget. #mi06 🇺🇸 pic.twitter.com/EyU8bdv8si

Common sense Red Flag laws – with stringent due process and probable cause – prevent those in imminent danger to themselves or others to have firearms. Law enforcement remains on the front-lines & ensuring they have another tool in their tool box would further help them.

(2/2)... Bipartisan Red Flag laws - with proper due process - need to be enacted to provide law enforcement and mental health authorities the tools to deny weapons capable of such carnage from being on the streets. Enough is enough.

For those of us who have witnessed this hatred firsthand in our communities, it is way overdue to enact a common sense response.   

We shake our heads in disbelief after innocent victims and precious lives are taken again and again... (1/2)

L. Brooks Patterson defined the word ‘legend’ among government leaders and statesmen. He was as strong as any governor, and like the old E.F. Hutton commercials, when Brooks talked, people listened. Michigan truly lost a giant among us.
